feed.title: Google Cloud: App Hub
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: App Hub

entry.content: App Hub has expanded its support for Google Cloud resources. You can now register services and workloads from a wide range of products to your applications, including new resources from Access Approval, Certificate Authority Service, Cloud Run, Firebase, Gemini for Google Cloud, GKE Multi-Cloud, and more. Many of these supported resources are available in Preview. For a complete list, see App Hub supported resources.
entry.summary: App Hub has expanded its support for Google Cloud resources, allowing registration of services and workloads from various products like Access Approval, Certificate Authority Service, Cloud Run, Firebase, Gemini for Google Cloud, and GKE Multi-Cloud. Many of these new resources are available in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: App Hub Now Supports More Google Cloud Services

entry.content:
Management projects are now Generally Available (GA) to enable application management in folders. This setup model is recommended for all new App Hub implementations and provides a centralized and scalable way to organize, deploy, and govern your applications.

Key features of this release include:

  • App-enabled folders: You can now enable application management on a standard Google Cloud folder, which then becomes an app-enabled folder. This folder acts as the application management boundary for your App Hub applications.
  • Management projects: A dedicated management project is automatically created within your app-enabled folder to store application metadata and configurations, and to centralize operations.
  • Simplified API management: Required APIs for core App Hub features are automatically enabled on the management project. You can also enable recommended APIs to access the full application lifecycle experience.
  • Flexible billing: Linking a billing account is now optional. You can use App Hub's core features for organizing and observing your applications at no cost. A billing account is required only for other application-centric features.

For more information on how to get started, see Set up App Hub with app-enabled folders.
entry.summary: App Hub is now generally available for managing applications within folders. This new model simplifies organization, deployment, and governance of your applications. Key features include app-enabled folders, dedicated management projects, simplified API management, and flexible billing options.
entry.title: Feature: App Hub Now Generally Available in Folders

entry.content:
App Hub supports resources from the following sources in Preview:

  • Vertex AI
  • Pipeline job
  • Custom job
  • Hyperparameter tuning job
  • Index
  • Index endpoint
  • NAS job
  • Model deployment monitoring job
  • Compute Engine
  • Autoscaler
  • Commitment
  • Disk
  • Regional disk
  • Instance template
  • Regional instance template
  • License
  • Node group
  • Image
  • Resource policy
  • Reservation
  • Node template
  • Router
  • Snapshot
  • Route
  • Subnetwork
  • Global public delegated prefix
  • Public delegated prefix
  • Dataflow
  • Job
  • Datastream
  • Stream
  • Cloud DNS
  • Managed zone
  • Policy
entry.summary: App Hub now supports resources from Vertex AI, Compute Engine, Dataflow, Datastream, and Cloud DNS in preview.
entry.title: Feature: App Hub Now Supports More Resources

entry.content:
The following Vertex AI supported resources are now generally available (GA):

  • Dataset items
  • Featurestore containers
  • MetadataStore instances
  • Model resources
entry.summary: Vertex AI resources are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New Vertex AI Resources

entry.content: Dataproc Metastore services are now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataproc Metastore services are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Dataproc Metastore now GA

entry.content:
App Hub supports resources from the following sources in Preview:

  • Dataproc Metastore Service
  • Vertex AI Dataset
  • Vertex AI Featurestore
  • Vertex AI MetadataStore
  • Vertex AI Model
entry.summary: App Hub now supports Dataproc Metastore Service, Vertex AI Dataset, Vertex AI Featurestore, Vertex AI MetadataStore, and Vertex AI Model in preview. This feature enhances App Hub's capabilities by integrating more services.
entry.title: Feature: App Hub adds new data services
